docs.abstract: There's an absolutely horrifying article in the current issue of Child Magazine about the food fight now raging between parents of children with life-threatening food allergies and parents of the allergy-free. The latter, apparently, have started to push back against "peanut-free" school regulations to assert their children's natural right to eat whatever they darn well [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: There's an absolutely horrifying article in the current issue of Child Magazine about the food fight now raging between parents of children with life-threatening food allergies and parents of the allergy-free. The latter, apparently, have started to push back against "peanut-free" school regulations to assert their children's natural right to eat whatever they darn well please.

headline.print_headline: Teaching Doctors to Teach Patients About Lifestyle
headline.main: Teaching Doctors to Teach Patients About Lifestyle

docs.lead_paragraph: There is a growing movement to inform health professionals and patients about the importance of lifestyle in preventing and treating disease.
docs.snippet: There is a growing movement to inform health professionals and patients about the importance of lifestyle in preventing and treating disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: The latest at the spa: DNA testing. Jennifer Kahn casts a critical eye.
docs.snippet: The latest at the spa: DNA testing. Jennifer Kahn casts a critical eye.

docs.abstract: Some high-end spas are offering DNA analysis as ultimate and most intimate evolution in personalized care; many offer recommendations or products based on variations in certain genes; while there is little proof that such personalized products can make difference, it makes sense that they might, given thousands of subtle variations in genetic functions that affect health and aging; clinical relevance of such testing discussed; photo (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: It is possible to get many things at the Four Seasons Hotel in Westlake Village, Calif., but a blood-and-urine panel that analyzes the condition of your DNA is a relatively new development. The panel, offered through the California WellBeing Institute as part of several luxury-lifestyle packages, including a $2,800 executive physical, is boomingly popular: about 50 people signed up in January, the first month it was available.
